title: How to Use Internet on a Nintendo 3DS

steps.headline: At the main menu of the 3DS, open the Internet.
steps.description: Do this by tapping the globe icon in the upper left-hand corner.

steps.headline: At the Internet menu, search for something in the search engine.
steps.description: It will automatically be set to Google. Type in a name, subject, or topic.

steps.headline: Tap the URL option to search for specific websites.
steps.description: Type in the URL code for a website to be taken directly there.

steps.headline: At a website, if you wish to visit it later, simply bookmark it.
steps.description: Do this by tapping Bookmarks at the menu and selecting "Add to Bookmarks". You can get rid of bookmarks by tapping the wrench icon on the Bookmark and selecting "Remove Bookmark".

steps.headline: In the options menu, you can delete your history and remove cookies.
steps.description: Removing cookies will erase all personal data put in websites (such as social media sites) and remove viruses.

steps.headline: Read the manual for a better understanding of the usage of the Internet on the 3DS.

text: At the main menu of the 3DS, open the Internet. Do this by tapping the globe icon in the upper left-hand corner. At the Internet menu, search for something in the search engine. It will automatically be set to Google. Type in a name, subject, or topic. Tap the URL option to search for specific websites. Type in the URL code for a website to be taken directly there. At a website, if you wish to visit it later, simply bookmark it. Do this by tapping Bookmarks at the menu and selecting "Add to Bookmarks". You can get rid of bookmarks by tapping the wrench icon on the Bookmark and selecting "Remove Bookmark". In the options menu, you can delete your history and remove cookies. Removing cookies will erase all personal data put in websites (such as social media sites) and remove viruses. Read the manual for a better understanding of the usage of the Internet on the 3DS.
